column3: I have autonomy in how I approach my work
column5: I can see how my work benefits users or the business
column6: I am learning and growing in my role
column7: I know what's expected of me
column8: My manager has enough time and context to support me effectively
column9: What's one thing that would improve your day-to-day experience?
better people-management skills for team leads / proper managers would help me feel more seen and appreciated

Clear communication channels between sales + Eng + marketing + CS

No back channel work assignment, no “high priority” declaration without technical insight specifically around customer issues

Understanding longer-term goals for the team, since we don't fit into a product team it would be nice to have yearly project goals. Or if our team is too interrupt driven to have that, at least let's have aspirational goals.
Moving away from over-reliance on automated PR reviews and asking for token "stamps", and going back to more thorough peer code reviews for all or most changes.
A bit more structure, time spent forming daily habits

I'm unsure, I'd say my day-to-day experience is not bad. I have autonomy to work, fairly clear goals, though some times not so clear competing high-priorities. I guess that and more predictable priorities in terms of our release plan and/or roadmap (internal one for next release) could help even more to understand priorities better.
the chance for more focused work, with less urgent interruptions
column10: I've never had so much support like I do here at any other place I've worked at - as long as I make sure I communicate any concerns, the whole leadership and management team has always been incredible at supporting me which is by far the biggest contributor to my happiness here. I really appreciate it.

column9: im actually quite happy with my day-to-day experience. I dont feel like i need to change or improve anything. I actually look forward to work on a Monday morning :D
I'll just be a lot happier in general when the onboarding numbers improve.
column10: I don't have too many gripes, generally I think the team and our responsibilities are well-organized and designed.
